concise_definition: v. 毁灭, 摧毁, 破坏 (destroy 的现在分词形式)

definitions.explanation_en: To cause severe damage to something so that it no longer exists or cannot function; to completely ruin or dismantle.
definitions.explanation_cn: 使某物遭受严重破坏，导致其不复存在或无法运作；彻底毁坏或拆解。
definitions.example_en: The earthquake was destroying entire neighborhoods in just seconds.
definitions.example_cn: 地震在几秒钟内就摧毁了整个街区。

definitions.explanation_en: To eliminate or put an end to something abstract, such as a system, belief, or relationship, often through forceful or deliberate action.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过强力或有意识的行为消除或终结某种抽象事物，如制度、信念或关系。
definitions.example_en: His words were destroying her confidence piece by piece.
definitions.example_cn: 他的话正在一点一点地摧毁她的自信。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause the collapse or failure of something vital, such as an economy, reputation, or hope, often through prolonged or cumulative damage.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过长期或累积性的损害，导致某项关键事物（如经济、声誉或希望）崩溃或失败。
definitions.example_en: Years of corruption were destroying the public’s trust in government.
definitions.example_cn: 多年的腐败正在摧毁公众对政府的信任。

comparison.analysis: “Damage” (损害) 指造成部分伤害或功能减弱，但不一定导致彻底毁灭。例如，窗户被砸碎是 damage，而整栋楼被炸平则是 destroying。前者可修复，后者通常不可逆。
“Demolish” (拆除/炸毁) 通常特指对建筑物或物理结构的系统性拆除，带有工程或计划性，多用于实体对象。而 “destroying” 范围更广，可涵盖物理、情感、抽象概念的彻底毁灭，语义更宽泛。
“Annihilate” (歼灭/彻底消灭) 比 “destroying” 更极端，强调完全从存在中抹除，不留任何痕迹，常用于军事、科学或神学语境（如原子湮灭）。而 “destroying” 可保留残骸，仅失去功能或意义。
